dispatch_complex_data ( $  Data,
$  Type 
)

Function processes arrays and objects.

Parameters:
$Data - Data to process.
$Type - Data type.
Returns:
- Processed data.
Note:
Empty string is not a valid value for the data of type 'integer' , 'float' , 'email' and 'integer_list'
Exceptions:
Exception An exception of this type is thrown.
Author:
Dodonov A.A.

Definition at line 516 of file supported_data_types.php.

            {
                  try
                  {
                        if( $this->Security === false )
                        {
                              $this->Security = get_package( 'security' , 'last' , __FILE__ );
                        }
                        $Ret = array();
                        foreach( $Data as $key => $d )
                        {
                              if( is_array( $d ) || is_object( $d ) )
                              {
                                    $d = $this->Security->get( $d , $Type );
                                    ( is_object( $d ) || count( $d ) ) ? $Ret[ $key ] = $d : false;
                              }
                              else
                              {
                                    if( $Type == 'string' || $Type == 'command' || $Type == 'raw' || strlen( $d ) != 0 )
                                    {
                                          $Ret[ $key ] = $this->Security->get( $d , $Type );
                                    }
                              }
                        }
                        return( $Ret );
                  }
                  catch( Exception $e )
                  {
                        $a = func_get_args();_throw_exception_object( __METHOD__ , $a , $e );
                  }
            }

Definition at line 115 of file supported_data_types.php.

            {
                  try
                  {
                        $Types = array( 'integer' , 'float' , 'command' , 'string' , 'email' , 'email' , 'set' , 'raw' );
                        
                        foreach( $Predicates as $p )
                        {
                              $Key = array_search( $p , $Types );
                              if( $Key !== false )
                              {
                                    return( $Types[ $Key ] );
                              }
                        }
                        
                        throw( new Exception( "Type was not found" ) );
                  }
                  catch( Exception $e )
                  {
                        $a = func_get_args();_throw_exception_object( __METHOD__ , $a , $e );
                  }
            }

            {
                  try
                  {
                        $RetData = '';
                        $s = strlen( $Data );
                        for( $i = 0 ; $i < $s ; $i++ )
                        {
                              if( ( $Data[ $i ] >= 'a' && $Data[ $i ] <= 'z' ) ||
                                    ( $Data[ $i ] >= 'A' && $Data[ $i ] <= 'Z' ) || 
                                    ( $Data[ $i ] >= '0' && $Data[ $i ] <= '9' ) || 
                                    $Data[ $i ] == '_' || $Data[ $i ] == ':' || $Data[ $i ] == '-' || $Data[ $i ] == '.' )
                              {
                                    $RetData .= $Data[ $i ];
                              }
                        }
                        
                        return( $RetData );
                  }
                  catch( Exception $e )

Definition at line 460 of file supported_data_types.php.

            {
                  try
                  {
                        switch( $Type )
                        {
                              case( 'integer' ):                  return( intval( $Data ) );
                              case( 'integer_list' ):       return( $this->process_integer_list_data( $Data ) );
                              case( 'float' ):              return( floatval( $Data ) );
                              case( 'command' ):                  return( $this->process_command_data( $Data ) );
                              case( 'string' ):             return( $this->process_string_data( $Data ) );
                              case( 'script' ):             return( $this->process_script_data( $Data ) );
                              case( 'unsafe_string' ):      return( $this->process_unsafe_string_data( $Data ) );
                              case( 'email' ):              return( $this->process_email_data( $Data ) );
                              case( 'raw' ):                      return( $Data );
                              default:                            throw( new Exception( 'Undefined data type' ) );
                        }
                  }
                  catch( Exception $e )
                  {
                        $a = func_get_args();_throw_exception_object( __METHOD__ , $a , $e );
                  }
            }

                              if( ( $Data[ $i ] >= 'a' && $Data[ $i ] <= 'z' ) ||
                                    ( $Data[ $i ] >= 'A' && $Data[ $i ] <= 'Z' ) ||

                                    $Data[ $i ] == '+' )
                              {

Definition at line 160 of file supported_data_types.php.

            {
                  try
                  {
                        if( is_array( $Data ) )
                        {
                              $Data = implode( ',' , $Data );
                        }
                        
                        $Matches = array();
                        $Data = str_replace( '\\' , '' , $Data );
                        preg_match( '/^[0-9\,\']+$/' , $Data , $Matches );
                        
                        if( count( $Matches ) > 0 )
                        {
                              return( $Data );
                        }
                        else
                        {
                              throw( new Exception( "Illegal symbols were found '$Data'" ) );
                        }
                  }
                  catch( Exception $e )
                  {
                        $a = func_get_args();_throw_exception_object( __METHOD__ , $a , $e );
                  }

Definition at line 308 of file supported_data_types.php.

            {
                  try
                  {
                        if( $this->String === false )
                        {
                              $this->String = get_package( 'string' , 'last' , __FILE__ );
                        }
                        
                        $Data = htmlspecialchars( $Data , ENT_QUOTES , 'UTF-8' );
                        $Data = str_replace( '{' , '[lfb]' , $Data );
                        $Data = str_replace( ';' , '[dot_comma]' , $Data );
                        $Data = str_replace( '=' , '[eq]' , $Data );
                        $Data = str_replace( '#' , '[sharp]' , $Data );
                        $Data = str_replace( '}' , '[rfb]' , $Data );
                        $Data = str_replace( "\r" , '[r]' , $Data );
                        $Data = str_replace( "\n" , '[n]' , $Data );

                        $Data = str_replace( '&' , '[amp]' , $Data );
                        
                        return( $Data );
                  }
                  catch( Exception $e )
                  {
                        $a = func_get_args();_throw_exception_object( __METHOD__ , $a , $e );

            {
                  try
                  {
                        if( $this->String === false )
                        {
                              $this->String = get_package( 'string' , 'last' , __FILE__ );
                        }
                        
                        $Data = $this->String->hide_safe_macro( $Data );
                        $Data = htmlspecialchars( $Data , ENT_QUOTES , 'UTF-8' );
                        $Data = str_replace( '{' , '[lfb]' , $Data );
                        $Data = str_replace( ';' , '[dot_comma]' , $Data );
                        $Data = str_replace( '=' , '[eq]' , $Data );
                        $Data = str_replace( '#' , '[sharp]' , $Data );
                        $Data = str_replace( '}' , '[rfb]' , $Data );
                        $Data = str_replace( "\r" , '[r]' , $Data );
                        $Data = str_replace( "\n" , '[n]' , $Data );
                        $Data = $this->String->show_safe_macro( $Data );
                        $Data = str_replace( '&' , '[amp]' , $Data );
                        
                        return( $Data );

Definition at line 358 of file supported_data_types.php.

            {
                  try
                  {
                        if( $this->String === false )
                        {
                              $this->String = get_package( 'string' , 'last' , __FILE__ );
                        }
                        
                        $Data = str_replace( '[lfb]' , '{' , $Data );
                        $Data = str_replace( '[dot_comma]' , ';' , $Data );
                        $Data = str_replace( '[eq]' , '=' , $Data );
                        $Data = str_replace( '[sharp]' , '#' , $Data );
                        $Data = str_replace( '[rfb]' , '}' , $Data );
                        $Data = str_replace( '[amp]' , '&' , $Data );
                        
                        $Data = htmlspecialchars_decode( $Data , ENT_QUOTES );
                        
                        return( $Data );
                  }
                  catch( Exception $e )
                  {
                        $a = func_get_args();_throw_exception_object( __METHOD__ , $a , $e );
